Hi Gordon,

Now I'm able to configure Heritrix to crawl a site. However it =
is
crawling the pages at very low rate, ie 0.05 pages/second( with 10
threa=
ds ). Is it possible to improve this ?

Thanks.



--- In archive-crawler@y=
ahoogroups.com, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
> That site doesn't curre=
ntly resolve for me.
> 
> I'm not sure what you mean for "Results"; are you=
 trying to crawl a 
> search engine's results page? If so, be aware most se=
arch engines ban 
> robots from their results pages.
> 
> In your private m=
ail, you included a 'scope' configuration which only 
> had one DecideRule,=
 to accept URIs of your patterns. Working scopes
have 
> many rules, includ=
ing some to support the fetching of prerequisite
URIs. 
> As you forwarded =
your scope, it would not accept a seed URI (such as a 
> search engine resu=
lts page) that did not fit the pattern, nor allow 
> certain preqrequisite =
fetches to complete.
> 
> I always recommend starting with a default, worki=
ng scope, then 
> incrementally changing it to match your needs -- leaving =
most of it 
> unchanged.
> 
> Hope this helps,
> 
> - Gordon @ IA
> 
> ramc=
